value.title: AI named after V For Vendetta masks protects photos from being gathered by facial recognition apps
value.excerpt: A new AI-powered program 'cloaks' images to ward off facial recognition apps. The tool makes subtle pixel-level changes that distort pictures enough so they cannot be used by online scrapers.

value.title: Federal bill would ban corporate facial recognition without consent
value.excerpt: Senator Jeff Merkley introduced a bill on Tuesday to prevent private corporations from collecting facial recognition data without people’s consent.

value.title: Singapore's Universal Studios deploys facial recognition for entry
value.excerpt: Visitors to Universal Studios in Singapore will now have to pass through facial recognition scanners to enter the park, in the city-state's latest foray with a technology that has stoked privacy concerns.

value.title: Richland, Columbia police use facial recognition, social media in protest tied arrests
value.excerpt: Richland County police are using facial recognition technology and combing social media to arrest people tied to the violence and unrest that followed peaceful protests in late May. value.title: Buildots raises $16M to bring computer vision to construction management
value.excerpt: Buildots, a Tel Aviv and London-based startup that is using computer vision to modernize the construction management industry, today announced that it has raised $16 million in total funding. value.title: Advertima rings up $17.5M for computer vision-powered behavioral analytics for in-store retail
value.excerpt: Swiss computer vision startup Advertima has raised a €15 million Series A (~$17.5 million) to build out a machine learning platform for physical retail stores to ‘upgrade’ the shopping experience via real-time shopper behavior analytics.

value.title: How Reuters analyzed Rite Aid's use of facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: Reuters analyzed Rite Aid stores in America's two biggest cities to determine which received facial recognition technology and which did not. The news agency gathered this data through one or more visits by Reuters journalists to all 75 Rite Aid locations in Manhattan and the central Los Angeles metro area from October 2019 through July 2020.

value.title: Face masks are thwarting even the best facial recognition algorithms, study finds
value.excerpt: Researchers from NIST found that face masks are causing facial recognition algorithms to fail as frequently as 50% of the time.

value.title: NIST study finds that masks defeat most facial recognition algorithms
value.excerpt: A National Institutes of Science and Technology found that 89 commercial facial recognition algorithms were defeated by masks.

value.title: This AI uses emoji to protect BLM protestors from facial recognition

value.title: New York legislature votes to halt facial recognition tech in schools for two years
value.excerpt: The state of New York voted this week to pause any implementation of facial recognition technology in schools for two years. The moratorium, approved by the New York Assembly and Senate Wednesday, comes after an upstate school district adopted the technology earlier this year,

value.title: Facebook will pay $650 million to settle facial recognition privacy lawsuit

value.title: Sens. Sanders, Warren, Wyden back national facial recognition ban bill
